issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

fields.description:
Building from source, via the instructions in the eucalyptus/INSTALL file, and doing a "make install" where:
$EUCALYPTUS=/opt/eucalyptus
(or any directory other than the root directory '/')

The make install works, but then after doing necessary configuration steps per the Install Guide, initialization of the cloud fails with:

{noformat}
# clcadmin-initialize-cloud
2015-12-11 13:38:39 INFO ulimit: resource=7 soft=1024 hard=4096
2015-12-11 13:38:39 INFO ulimit: resource=7 soft=65535 hard=65535
2015-12-11 13:38:39 INFO ulimit: resource=6 soft=15176 hard=15176
2015-12-11 13:38:39 INFO ulimit: resource=6 soft=-1 hard=-1
2015-12-11 13:38:40 ERROR 0715 Can't find library directory //usr/share/eucalyptus
2015-12-11 13:38:40 ERROR 0581 Service exit with a return value of 1.
/opt/eucalyptus/usr/sbin/clcadmin-initialize-cloud: cloud initialization failed
{noformat}

The setting in root's .bashrc:
{noformat}
export EUCALYPTUS="/opt/eucalyptus"
export PATH=$PATH:$EUCALYPTUS/usr/sbin
{noformat}

Per EUCA-11820, if I rsync the files in /opt/eucalyptus to /, the command will find the share files and continue (but then hits EUCA-11367, which is irrelevant to this issue).

It should find the share files in /opt/eucalyptus/usr/share/eucalyptus, but it only looks in /usr/share/eucalyptus.
fields.summary: Building from source to non-'/' $EUCALYPTUS causes clcadmin-initialize-cloud to fail

comments.body: It looks like eucalyptus-cloud isn't paying attention to the value of the EUCALYPTUS environment variable when it is set.
Check if command-line arg is set and if not, grab it from the environment.

Patch has been committed to master.

$EUCALYPTUS if set will act as the default value for the eucalyptus home argument. It will be overridden by the cli argument if passed in.
Fix pushed to master and ready for validation.

So as a part of removing the files generated from gengetopt that will break this fix.

Going to reassign back to myself.
Rejecting because the fix for EUCA-12159 will break this proposed resolution.
Changing priority given the circumstances and will re-evaluate the need for the fix. This is non-standard installation so it's likely much lower on the chances of encountering.
With the removal of the generated files from gengetopt from source control this should no longer be an issue as long as the prefix given to configure is the installation location.

So here's the state of this bug right now:

* \-h/\-\-home now defaults to its build-time value.
* \-u/\-\-user defaults to {{eucalyptus}}.
* eucalyptus-cloud ignores the environment variables for both due to the way gengetopt works.

This means two cases are affected:
* Those who configure eucalyptus for one location and run it from another
* Those who run eucalyptus as a UID other than {{eucalyptus}}.

Those cases are rare, even among eucalyptus developers, and they both have workarounds:  add the appropriate options to CLOUD_OPTS or run executables with those appropriate options instead.  Note that clcadmin-initialize-cloud accepts the same options as eucalyptus-cloud itself.  This bug, however, should now be fixed by commit {{6fa05f3}} for EUCA-12159.  If addressing the cases above without using CLOUD_OPTS is truly important than let's file a bug against eucalyptus-cloud for its ignorance of the EUCALYPTUS and EUCA_USER environment variables.
Ran install via rpm install (did not init), then tried to recompile with steps in INSTALL, did not see that error on init command.

On that run, I did see the following output, however.
2016-07-13 18:20:03 INFO ulimit: resource=7 soft=1024 hard=4096
2016-07-13 18:20:03 INFO ulimit: resource=7 soft=65535 hard=65535
2016-07-13 18:20:03 INFO ulimit: resource=6 soft=28219 hard=28219
2016-07-13 18:20:03 INFO ulimit: resource=6 soft=-1 hard=-1
2016-07-13 18:20:03 20683 INFO User did not set heap size. Setting it automatically to 4GB base on total memory of 7428812800 bytes
2016-07-13 18:20:04 INFO Returning Bootstrapper instance.
2016-07-13 18:20:23 INFO Executing Pre-Shutdown Hooks...
2016-07-13 18:20:23 INFO Executing Shutdown Hooks...
2016-07-13 18:20:23 INFO Executing Post-Shutdown Hooks...
2016-07-13 18:20:23 INFO Executing Post-Shutdown Hook: com.eucalyptus.system.Threads$ThreadPool$1@6a04c61c
2016-07-13 18:20:23 INFO SHUTDOWN:Eucalyptus.SYSTEM Stopping thread pool...
2016-07-13 18:20:23 20680 ERROR 0597 Service exit with a return value of 37.
/opt/eucalyptus/usr/sbin/clcadmin-initialize-cloud: cloud initialization failed

[~ethomas],
Can you clarify the state of this issue? I'm a bit confused. If the fix failed it should not be back to In QA. If the fix for the described bug is done but you hit another. It would be best to close this and open a new one.

[~tony] Since I didn't see the same error, and the description says that another error should occur (infinite db loop) I thought it should be closed as that error no longer exists.  However, I am not sure I ran the steps correctly, as the INSTALL file only discusses make install after an rpm build.  I was going to document the steps I used exactly to make sure this was not user error, so this is still being verified, hence back in QA.  I will post another comment when I have recorded the steps I performed.

[~lincoln.thomas][~tony] The INSTALL file in master no longer describes how to do an initial build with a ./configure and make install, rather it uses an rpm-build first.  Running the rpm build does not honor the $EUCALYPTUS variable, as it sets -prefix to / during it's 'configure' command.  Having said that I tried the following commands (cut and paste into a shell window) on a fresh install of centos 6u7 from qa, and ended up with the error in one of my previous comments (return value of 37).  I think I am doing this wrong.  Any verification help would be appreciated.

{code}
echo "export EUCAGIT=~/euca/git" >> ~/.bashrc
echo "export EUCARPM=~/euca/rpmbuild" >> ~/.bashrc
echo "export JAVA_HOME=\"/usr/lib/jvm/java-1.8.0/\"" >> ~/.bashrc
echo "export JAVA=\"\$JAVA_HOME/bin/java\"" >> ~/.bashrc
echo "export EUCALYPTUS=\"/opt/eucalyptus\"" >> ~/.bashrc
echo "export PATH=\$EUCALYPTUS/usr/sbin:\$PATH" >> ~/.bashrc
echo "export EUCASTART=--enable-sysvinit" >> ~.bashrc

source ~/.bashrc
mkdir -p $EUCAGIT $EUCAPKGS $EUCARPM/SPECS $EUCARPM/SOURCES

yum install -y git yum-utils wget http://download.fedoraproject.org/pub/epel/6/x86_64/epel-release-6-8.noarch.rpm http://elrepo.org/linux/elrepo/el6/x86_64/RPMS/elrepo-release-6-5.el6.elrepo.noarch.rpm

yum install -y http://downloads.eucalyptus.com/software/eucalyptus/nightly/devel/centos/6/x86_64/eucalyptus-release-nightly-0-3.el6.noarch.rpm
yum install -y http://downloads.eucalyptus.com/software/euca2ools/nightly/devel/centos/6/x86_64/euca2ools-release-nightly-0-2.el6.noarch.rpm

git clone https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus.git $EUCAGIT/eucalyptus
git clone https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-rpmspec.git $EUCAGIT/eucalyptus-rpmspec
git clone https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-cloud-libs.git $EUCAGIT/eucalyptus-cloud-libs

yum -y groupinstall development

yum-builddep -y --nogpgcheck eucalyptus

cd /tmp && wget http://archive.apache.org/dist/ant/ivy/2.1.0/apache-ivy-2.1.0-bin.tar.gz && tar -zxvf apache-ivy-2.1.0-bin.tar.gz && cp -p apache-ivy-2.1.0/ivy-2.1.0.jar /usr/share/java && ln -fs /usr/share/java/ivy-2.1.0.jar /usr/share/java/ivy.jar

if [ -n "$EUCARPM" ]; then rm -Rf $EUCARPM/*/*; fi

ln -fs $EUCAGIT/eucalyptus-rpmspec/eucalyptus.spec $EUCARPM/SPECS
cd $EUCAGIT && tar -cvJf $EUCARPM/SOURCES/eucalyptus.tar.xz --exclude .git --exclude eucalyptus/clc/lib --exclude build-info.properties eucalyptus
cd $EUCAGIT/eucalyptus-cloud-libs && tar -cvJf $EUCARPM/SOURCES/eucalyptus-cloud-libs.tar.xz *.jar licenses

rpmbuild --define "_topdir $EUCARPM" --define 'tarball_basedir eucalyptus' --define 'cloud_lib_tarball eucalyptus-cloud-libs.tar.xz' -bb $EUCARPM/SPECS/eucalyptus.spec

yum install -y $EUCARPM/RPMS/noarch/* $EUCARPM/RPMS/x86_64/*
mkdir -p $EUCALYPTUS
cd $EUCAGIT/eucalyptus
./configure --with-axis2==/usr/share/java/axis2 --with-axis2c=/usr/lib64/axis2c --prefix=$EUCALYPTUS --with-apache2-module-dir=/usr/lib64/httpd/modules --with-db-home=/ --with-wsdl2c-sh=$EUCAGIT/eucalyptus/devel/euca-WSDL2C.sh $EUCASTART
make clean && make && make install
which clcadmin-initialize-cloud
clcadmin-initialize-cloud


{code}
[~jbreiding], it looks like the only change for this issue was to use the EUCALYPTUS environment variable, is there anything else that needs to be verified?

[~sjones] i think that's correct, but Jeremy can verify.

[~ethomas] and I chatted yesterday. He is going to test this out on 4.3 both on el6 and el7. Jeremy only applied this to el6 4.3 code at the time, so we actually don't know if it will work on el7. The change to systemd might throw a wrench into this fix. Evan's testing will tell. If any problems, we will re-open this and probably punt it to 4.3.1, because nothing in 4.3.0 depends on this. Since there's also no requirement to build and install 4.3.0 from source with a non-default $EUCALYPTUS (setting it to '/' always works in el6 or el7, for 4.2.x and 4.3.0), I don't know why this is was ever set to Critical. Dropping it to Minor, let me know if you disagree.

Regardless, I will update the INSTALL procedure file based on test results, I've opened EUCA-12575 for 4.3.1 to track that work so we don't need to keep this open.

In a strict sense, we don't see the same error that we saw before when we run this clcadmin-initialize-cloud.  In all cases however, we do see the Exit code 37, running from the rpm build (as described in my comments) or using a source deploy from https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/~shaon/Eucalyptus+Source+Installation.  So while maybe I should verify this as the error no longer occurs, this bug has kind of been turned into a catck all for the $EUCALYPTUS variable not being used everywhere, and is frankly, probably a rat hole to diagnose entirely.   Further work is warranted.

As large as this could possibly be I think one catch all is not the right way to address it.

This was meant to be addressed via ./configure && make install.

The underlying cause was the committed files from gengetopt which is where euca_rootwrap got these values from.

Since we have moved away from recommending that path in the install guide we should address the issue in another ticket so history doesnt look so confusing for the issue.

[~lincoln.thomas] thoughts?
